page.title: 10GOVERNMENT
page.content: The work of the Parish Council isto watch over the interests of the local people.Elections are held every four years and there are ten seats.At the moment High Ongar Parish Council consists of three ladies and seven men.The chairman is changed every year.Meetings are held 8 times a year and are open to the public to attend. At the end of every session there is a question time and anyone may speak.The duties of the Parish Council include noting any appliction for planning permission which may affect the area,street lighting and maintenance of public buildings.One person represents the Parish Council as a menber of the High Ongar Primary School Governing body.There are also liason meetings wih the district council.A member of the council if re- elected may serve as long as he wishes
